summary: Backend-only testing of Gamma Match Geometric K Model Enhancement. All 12 tests passed (plus 13 regression tests). The new physics model correctly derives step-up ratio K from bar position geometry: K = 1 + (bar_pos/half_element_length) × (Z0_gamma/73). Different Yagis now need different bar positions for 50Ω match.
context_for_next_testing_agent: Geometric K model tests added. Key fields in matching_info: step_up_k_squared, ideal_bar_position_inches, ideal_step_up_ratio, coupling_multiplier. Formula: K = 1 + (bar_pos/half_element_length) × coupling_multiplier where coupling_multiplier = Z0_gamma/73.

new_matching_info_fields.step_up_k_squared: K² value computed from bar position (e.g., 2.551 for 3-elem at bar=12.61")
new_matching_info_fields.coupling_multiplier: Z0_gamma/73 (e.g., 4.806 for std gamma rod geometry)

verified_physics.custom_tube_od: 1.0" tube gives cap/inch=3.38 pF/in vs default 0.625" tube=8.72 pF/in
verified_physics.regression_tests: 13 prior gamma physics tests still pass ✓
